channel.title: World largest silencer.
channel.description:
[img]https://www.darkgovernment.com/news/wp-content/uploads/2010/02/worlds-largest-silencer.jpg[/img] Before you ask : it is [i][b]real[/b][/i]. Before you ask again : yes, it totally warrants a new thread.
Whoever designed it is a sick. fucking. genius.
EDIT: damn I fucked up the title. What the fuck ever. Discuss.

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
but the noise reduction ain’t worth shit either

Well if it stops driving neighbours apeshit I think it is worth something.

Jesus, can’t you people fucking read?

Read full topic

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: vivanto
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

I don’t really know what logic you follow here.

^Add to it that the round isn’t being shot horizontally, and it wouldn’t be straight even if it were. Ballistic trajectory is caused by gravitational force, not air resistance.

All it does is lose a little stopping power, nothing worth mentioning, but the noise reduction ain’t worth shit either.

Read full topic

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Guess what happens as soon as a round escapes a silencer?

The usual howitzer shot travels such long distances and reaches such high altitudes that adding a silencer wouldn’t change shit.
I don’t really know what logic you follow here.

Read full topic

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: HumanParadoxx
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

How the fuck can a straight barrel be made more straight?
Also, ballistic trajectory is anything BUT straight. Go back to physics classes.

If anything, a suppressor can screw accuracy.

On a side note:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-cz8uZWtt3Q&feature=fvwrel
Keep pressing 7

ballistic trajectory are straight on a horizontal axis. Thus, external wind doesn’t affect a bullet if it is still inside of an structure, like the supressor.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:

The shell wuld go out on a more straight trajectory.

Also, ballistic trajectory is anything BUT straight. Go back to physics classes.

If anything, a suppressor can screw accuracy.

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
samuel2213:

a silencer is pointless on a weapon that is designed to shoot explosives. You might be able to silence the barrel, but not the explosion

Not if you shoot duds.

Those Paladin Tanks are VERY loud. I doubt any of you can even imagine.

I don’t doubt one bit people bitched and moaned a little bit. I lived off post for a little while nearing the end of my term and you could hear these things go off and the range they’re firing at had to be 15 miles from where I was. But it sounded like fire works goin off a at a fair distance.

I could see how this monstrosity could help out a little bit to turn a firework pop into a small thud if not eliminating the sound all together. (At 15 miles away)

Edit* Actually looking at the pictures again. I would say that those suppressors most likely don’t even leave the range. They probably just cover them up so they aren’t exposed to the elements when they’re not in use.

Oh gawd someone gets it

Read full topic

item.title: World largest silencer.
item.dc:creator: Guzzi
item.description:
Those Paladin Tanks are VERY loud. I doubt any of you can even imagine.

I don’t doubt one bit people bitched and moaned a little bit. I lived off post for a little while nearing the end of my term and you could hear these things go off and the range they’re firing at had to be 15 miles from where I was. But it sounded like fire works goin off a at a fair distance.

I could see how this monstrosity could help out a little bit to turn a firework pop into a small thud if not eliminating the sound all together. (At 15 miles away)

Edit* Actually looking at the pictures again. I would say that those suppressors most likely don’t even leave the range. They probably just cover them up so they aren’t exposed to the elements when they’re not in use.

Read full topic
